result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine Birt

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jermaine Birt in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CM155. 15CM185 & 16CM243 called at 11:15 am  16TR1397 State moves to vacate jument and dismiss.  16CM243 Ct 1 plea, Ct 2 DRI, Ct 3 Plea. CT 4 & 5 plea  Ct 6 Dismisse & Conssolidate   15CM185 DRI   & 15cm155 DRI   243 Ct 1 BAC .181  Total fine $1165.00, 45 days jail, revocation 14 mo., IID 14 mo and alcohol assessment   Ct 3,4,5 probation 24 mo  cost, DNA  no violent & abusive  contact with L.J. Domestic abuse counseling & counseling as deemed.  Counsel and def agree with plea agreement as stated.   Plea advisement form completed and reviewed with def.  16CM243 Ct 1 - OWI 2 no contest   Ct 3 - No contest.  Ct 4  No contest plea  Ct 5 - No contest.  Court will grants states motion 16CM243  Ct 2 DRI  & Ct 6 dismissed and consolidated.  15CM155 & 15CM185 dismissed and read in   Constitutional rights,  right to jury trial and elements reviewed.   Fine on OWI should by $1665.00   Court finds def has freely and voluntaily entered into this plea agreement, def understands charges, penalties and rights.    Factual basis.   Court will accept pleas, found guilty, Ct 1, 3, 4, & 5 in 16CM243.   Victim rights have been complied with.  Brief recess  11:31 am  Reconvene 11:34 am   State informs court that def is objecting to probation.  State presents sentencing arguments.  If no probation state requesting 6 mo jail on each, Ct 3, 4,& 5 concurrent but consecutive to Ct 1.  BAC level .181    Atty Scholke presents sentencing arguments.   Credit for 14 days.   Statement by def.   Court gives def option of 4 months jail on each or probation.   Def wil take 4 months    Ct 1 - Fine & cost $1665.00 included DNA & IID   Revo 14 mo   IID 14 month   Credit for admin suspension   Alcohol assessement and drivers safety plan.  Sentenced to 45 days jail.   Credit 14 days.   Huber privileges.   Jail will commence 7:00 pm  today.  Ct  3  4, 5  Jail 4 months.  concurrent with each other, consecutive to ct 1. Huber privileges Cost & DNA surcharge. $300.00  Bond will be applied.    Bond of $250.00 was ordered forfeited however  will apply towards fine & cost.    Jail credit will be 40 days.  Payment plan to commence when released from jail.  Post conviction rights.  16TR1397 is reopened and dismissed by court

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
to Adjourn Jury Trial
(Routed to JA)

Defendant Jermaine  Birt in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CM243, 15CM155, 15CM185 @ 11:36 a.m. Discussion prior to going on the record. Was set for plea/sentencing. Matters are not resolved. Court will set 15CM155 for jury trial as #1. That case will be a trial or plea/sentencing on that day, others will track as status conf. JT 4/11/18 @ 9:00 a.m., counsel in chambers at 8:30. FPT  3/26/18 @ 3:30 p.m. Def and Atty Goetz must appear. Proposed verdict and jury instructions to be submitted week before final pretrial. Remarks by the Court.  Status conference scheduled for March 26, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on November 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jermaine Birt in court by video, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM155 and 15CM185 @ 3:10 p.m. Court reviews status of case. State asks for cash bond. Court questions Def's ability to post. Statement by Defendant. Bond set w/condition to cover both files. Def advised to contact Atty Dodge.  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jermaine Birt not in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM185 and 15CM155 @ 2:56 p.m. Def failed to appear at final pre-trial. State asks for statewide warrant, $1000 or body. Covers both files.  Court so orders.

Defendant Jermaine Birt not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CM155 & 15CM185  @ 10:47 am. State would like to lift no contact provision with L.J. Court will delete no contact provision with L.J. in both cases.  COC to give copy to Jail.

Defendant Jermaine Birt in court with attorney Gary Stephen Dodge.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 1:10 pm.  State has complied with victim rights. Atty Dodge has copy of criminal complaint, waives reading, & enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives not guilty plea.  Atty Dodge gives bond argument. Def. makes statement.  State gives statement. Court modifies to $500.00 signature bond, w/condition. Def. does not have to appear for Status Cnf.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
